com.communote.server.widgets

Class AbstractWidget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.communote.server.widgets.AbstractWidget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Widget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AboutBlogWidget, AboutUserProfileWidget, AbstractMultipleResultWidget, AnnotatedSingleResultWidget, ClientPermissionsWidget, ContentTypeWidget, CreateNoteWidget, DeleteTopicWidget, EditTopicStructureWidget, EmptyWidget, FormWidget, GroupSettingsWidget, IpRangeWidget, LoggingWidget, MainPageHorizontalNavigationWidget, MessagesWidget, MultiViewTabWidget, SetAnonymousAccessWidget, TagManagementWidget, UserGroupAddMemberWidget, UserGroupDialogWidget, UserManagementUserOverviewWidget, UserProfileWidget

    public abstract class AbstractWidget
extends Object
implements Widget
    abstract implementation of the widget interface
    Author:
    Communote GmbH - http://www.communote.com/

      • getLongArrayParameter

        public Long[] getLongArrayParameter(String parameterName)
        Get the value of the given parameter. If it is not null split it by COMMA. Return the array. (null if the value of the parameter is null)
        Parameters:
        parameterName - the name of the parameter
        Returns:
        an array with the parameters splitted by comma, or null if the was parameter not set or did not contain any parseable long

      • getParameterEscaped

        public String getParameterEscaped(String key)
        Return a parameter with all characters that are not in [A-Za-z0-9_.-] escaped with underscore. Helps to avoid XSS when the parameter, which might have been manipulated, needs to be written out to the HTML so that it can be processed in Javascript code. The return value should be stored in a local variable when needed more than once.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the parameter
        Returns:
        the escaped parameter value or null if not set

      • getParameterEscaped

        public String getParameterEscaped(String key,
                                  String fallback)
        Like getParameterEscaped(String) but returns the provided fallback if the parameter is not set. The fallback is processed by the escape function.
        Parameters:
        key - the name of the parameter to get
        fallback - the fallback value if the parameter is not set
        Returns:
        the parameter value or the fallback

      • getParameters

        public Map<String,String> getParameters()
        Get the parameter list

        Returns:

      • getResponseMetadata

        public String getResponseMetadata()
        Description copied from interface: Widget
        Return a JSON object containing arbitrary metadata the server-side widget component wants to transmit to the client-side component as part of the current response.
        Specified by:
        getResponseMetadata in interface Widget
        Returns:
        a string serialized JSON object or null if no metadata needs to be transmitted

      • getStringArrayParameter

        public String[] getStringArrayParameter(String parameterName)
        Get the value of the given parameter. If it is not null split it by BLANK. Return the array. (null if the value of the parameter is null)
        Parameters:
        parameterName - name of the parameter key
        Returns:
        an array with the parameters splitted by blank

      • setResponseMetadata

        protected void setResponseMetadata(String key,
                                   Object value)
        Add, remove or replace an entry in the response metadata that should be returned when getResponseMetadata() is called.
        Parameters:
        key - the key of the entry to modify
        value - the value of the metadata entry, if null the entry with the provided key will be removed

      • setSuccess

        protected void setSuccess(boolean success)
        Set whether the widget request was successful.
        Parameters:
        success - true if the request succeeded
